meanings.definition: One who plies or works diligently.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated plyer never gives up on a task.
meanings.sent2: The hardworking plyer always completes assignments on time.
meanings.sent3: The diligent plyer was nicknamed 'The Task Master' by colleagues.
meanings.sent4: Her work ethic was like that of a plyer, unwavering and persistent.
meanings.sent5: The image of the plyer tirelessly working inspired others to do the same.

meanings.definition: A tool with two jaws for gripping or bending objects.
meanings.sent1: He used the plyer to tighten the loose bolt.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic always carries a plyer in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the shiny plyer, mistaking it for a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the same effect on him as a plyer, gripping his attention.
meanings.sent5: The rusty plyer lay forgotten in the corner, waiting to be used again.

meanings.sent1: The cake had a delicious plyer of frosting on top.
meanings.sent2: She added another plyer of paint to the canvas to create depth.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy jumped into the fresh plyer of leaves.
meanings.sent4: The memories formed a protective plyer around her heart.
meanings.sent5: The thick plyer of snow covered the entire landscape in white.
